Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Angels host the Chicago White Sox on Monday to start a three-game series.
The Angels have a 41-16 record in games when they scored five or more runs.
The White Sox are 27-48 in games when they record at least eight hits.
Taylor Ward is second on the Angels with 52 extra base hits (26 doubles, two triples and 24 home runs).
Niko Kavadas is 9-for-35 with a double, two home runs and three RBI over the last 10 games.
Andrew Benintendi leads Chicago with 17 home runs while slugging.384.
Andrew Vaughn is 15-for-40 with two home runs and five RBI over the last 10 games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Angels have gone 30-45 in home games and 60-89 overall.
Chicago is 15-57 on the road and 35-115 overall.
Monday's game is the first time these teams meet this season.
Others: The pitching probable for the Angels is Reid Detmers (4-6, 5.64 ERA, 1.40 WHIP, 88 strikeouts).
The pitching probable for the White Sox is Jonathan Cannon (3-10, 4.56 ERA, 1.40 WHIP, 74 strikeouts).
The current line is Angels -187, White Sox +156; over/under is 8 runs.
